contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "Join us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Throw in your lot with us

contextId.information: "Yahweh will be by your side." A person standing by another person's side is an idiom that means that the one person will help and support the other. AT: "Yahweh will support and defend you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh will be on your side

contextId.information: This is a figure of speech saying that you are going to trap yourself. AT: "you have made a trap in which you yourself are caught" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: you have laid a trap for yourself

contextId.information: This figure of speech uses "breathes" to refer to lying constantly. AT: "constantly lies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is a way of saying that this person will die as a result. AT: "it would kill him" or "he would die soon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"head" represents the whole person. AT: "are given to" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This is an idiom. Here "fall" represents destruction or failure. AT: "will be destroyed" or "awaits a bad future" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This phrase represents the idea he has from his own observation, imagination or memory. AT: "in his own opinion" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here to "open the way" means to create an opportunity. AT: "may create an opportunity for him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom. Here walking refers to living. AT: "who lives in his integrity" or "who lives an honest life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This idiom refers to a person who is easily angered. AT: "A person who does not control his temper" or "A person who becomes angry quickly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

This refers to the person bearing the consequences for what happens when he gets angry. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "must bear the consequences of his anger" or "must bear the consequences of what he does in his anger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This is an idiom. Here "listening" does not mean to merely listen, but to learn from the advice you are given and to follow it. AT: "Pay attention to advice" or "Follow advice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

Here walking refers to living. See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:19:01|19:1]]. AT: "lives by his integrity" or "lives an honest life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The phrase "come to" here means to transition into a new situation; to become. AT: "become poor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

This compares the way one lives to a crooked road one may travel. This is also an idiom. AT: "The way a guilty person lives is crooked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: The way of a guilty person is crooked

contextId.information: This is an idiom. AT: "The one who will not listen when poor people ask for help" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: The one who shuts his ears to the cry of the poor

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "pretends to be courageous" or 2) "will not listen to correction." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom.  AT: "he really does not want you to enjoy the meal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: his heart is not with you

contextId.information: This is an idiom. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:22:17|22:17]]. AT: "Do your best to understand and remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom. "too difficult for a fool to understand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The words "lie in wait" are an idiom. AT: "Do not hide and wait for the right time." Translate "lie in wait" as in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:01:10|1:11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom. AT: "cause him to have a guilty conscience and be ashamed of what he has done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: shovel coals of fire on his head

contextId.information: The stingy man is spoken of as if he was chasing after wealth. AT: "is greedy for riches" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"resists the rebukes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Speaking is a metonym for using words to defend innocent people. AT: "Defend those who cannot defend themselves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Speak for those who cannot speak
